publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1900 Tricia Marwick: Voices of Women Campaign—That the Parliament welcomes the formation of the Voices of Women (VOW) campaign to assist, encourage and to provide advice and information to black and ethnic minority women in Fife and wishes them every success in their efforts to attract funding to support the organisation and the valuable work that is being undertaken.
S1M-1900 Voices of Women Campaign (lodged on 2 May 2001) Michael Matheson*, Mr Alex Salmond*

S1M-1900 Tricia Marwick: Voices of Women Campaign—That the Parliament welcomes the formation of the Voices of Women (VOW) campaign to assist, encourage and to provide advice and information to black and ethnic minority women in Fife and wishes them every success in their efforts to attract funding to support the organisation and the valuable work that is being undertaken. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Mr Alex Salmond, Mr Keith Harding*
S1M-1900 Voices of Women Campaign (lodged on 2 May 2001) Ms Sandra White*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-1900 Voices of Women Campaign (lodged on 2 May 2001) Irene McGugan*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S1M-1900 Voices of Women Campaign (lodged on 2 May 2001) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Mr Gil Paterson*

S1M-1900 Tricia Marwick: Voices of Women Campaign—That the Parliament welcomes the formation of the Voices of Women (VOW) campaign to assist, encourage and to provide advice and information to black and ethnic minority women in Fife and wishes them every success in their efforts to attract funding to support the organisation and the valuable work that is being undertaken. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Mr Alex Salmond, Mr Keith Harding, Ms Sandra White, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Marilyn Livingstone, Tommy Sheridan, Irene McGugan, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Gil Paterson, Alex Neil*
S1M-1900 Voices of Women Campaign (lodged on 2 May 2001) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-1900 Voices of Women Campaign (lodged on 2 May 2001) Linda Fabiani*, Andrew Wilson*

S1M-1900 Tricia Marwick: Voices of Women Campaign—That the Parliament welcomes the formation of the Voices of Women (VOW) campaign to assist, encourage and to provide advice and information to black and ethnic minority women in Fife and wishes them every success in their efforts to attract funding to support the organisation and the valuable work that is being undertaken. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Mr Alex Salmond, Mr Keith Harding, Ms Sandra White, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Marilyn Livingstone, Tommy Sheridan, Irene McGugan, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Gil Paterson, Alex Neil, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Adam Ingram, Linda Fabiani, Andrew Wilson
S1M-1900 Voices of Women Campaign (lodged on 2 May 2001) Fiona Hyslop*, Fiona McLeod*

S1M-1900 Tricia Marwick: Voices of Women Campaign—That the Parliament welcomes the formation of the Voices of Women (VOW) campaign to assist, encourage and to provide advice and information to black and ethnic minority women in Fife and wishes them every success in their efforts to attract funding to support the organisation and the valuable work that is being undertaken. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Mr Alex Salmond, Mr Keith Harding, Ms Sandra White, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Marilyn Livingstone, Tommy Sheridan, Irene McGugan, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Gil Paterson, Alex Neil, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Adam Ingram, Linda Fabiani, Andrew Wilson, Fiona Hyslop, Fiona McLeod
